title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 154.1 - Liberation and taking of domestic waterfowl
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 154.1 - Liberation and taking of domestic waterfowl

State Regulations

Domestic waterfowl liberated under a license issued
pursuant to section 11-1903 of the Fish and Wildlife Law shall be taken only
under authorization from the department, upon written application, as
follows: (a) The department may
authorize the licensee to take mallard ducks between September 1 and March 31
when it shall appear to its satisfaction that the shooting is to be done only
on birds liberated in controlled drives and in such a manner as to preclude the
taking of any wild waterfowl. No more than the number so liberated shall be
taken. (b) The department may
authorize the licensee to kill other domestic waterfowl, by shooting, only in
accordance with all the applicable hunting regulations governing the taking of
like species from the wild. Notes

154.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
